sentences.sContent: It’s Dad’s birthday and we’re going out for a meal to celebrate.
sentences.sCn: 今天是爸爸的生日，我们打算出去吃饭庆祝一下。

sentences.sContent: My folks are celebrating their 50th anniversary.
sentences.sCn: 我父母正在庆祝他们结婚50周年。

sentences.sContent: We hope to give fans something to celebrate this season.
sentences.sCn: 我们希望在本赛季能给球迷一些值得庆祝的事。

sentences.sContent: ...So it’s no surprise that cultures around the world celebrate spring by honoring the egg...
...One of my most embarrassing moments was when I had a Chinese-American employee put in a request to take time off to celebrate Chinese New Year...

synos.tran: 庆祝；过节；举行宗教仪式

words.tran: 司仪神父；主持仪式的人；主持弥撒的教父
庆祝（celebrate的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranOther: to show that an event or occasion is important by doing something special or enjoyable
